sections.title: Introduction (Wide Shot)
sections.content: Hi, I’m Sayed Jihad Al Sayed, and welcome to my web development series. In this tutorial, we'll be diving into the basics of HTML and CSS, the foundational technologies for creating web pages. By the end of this series, you'll be equipped to build and style your own web pages from scratch.

sections.title: What is HTML and CSS? (Wide Shot)
sections.content: Before we get started, let’s talk briefly about what HTML and CSS are and why they are essential.

sections.title: HTML Explanation (Wide Shot)
sections.content: HTML, or HyperText Markup Language, is the standard language used to create web pages. It provides the structure of a webpage, using elements like headings, paragraphs, lists, and more.

sections.title: CSS Explanation (Wide Shot)
sections.content: CSS, or Cascading Style Sheets, is used to style and layout web pages. With CSS, you can control the color, fonts, spacing, and overall layout of your HTML elements.

sections.title: Example of HTML and CSS (Close Shot + Screen Recording)
sections.content: Here’s a simple example. On the left, we have an HTML document with a few basic elements. On the right, we have a CSS file that styles those elements.

code.html:
Hello, World!

This is a paragraph.

sections.title: Combining HTML and CSS (Close Shot + Screen Recording)
sections.content: In the HTML file, we define a heading and a paragraph. In the CSS file, we specify that the heading should be blue and centered, and the paragraph should have a specific font and color.

sections.title: Series Overview (Wide Shot)
sections.content: Throughout this series, we’ll break down these concepts into easy-to-understand sections. We’ll start with the basics of HTML, move on to CSS, and then combine them to create a simple, styled web page.

sections.title: Next Video Teaser (Wide Shot)
sections.content: So, let’s get started! In the next video, we’ll dive into the basic structure of an HTML document. Make sure to follow along and try out the examples yourself.

sections.title: Engagement Call-to-Action (Close Shot)
sections.content: If you have any questions or need further clarification, feel free to drop a comment below. Don’t forget to like, subscribe, and hit the notification bell so you don’t miss any updates.
